summary: Is it me, or does this song [link here] have some very Aziraphale/Crowley vibes? Especially them during their meeting in Eden....
body:
Is it me, or does this song [link here] have some very Aziraphale/Crowley vibes? Especially them during their meeting in Eden. (Sorry in advance for the rough translation—my German isn’t that advanced.)

But since that moment
when your gaze understood me,
there is sudden clarity in longing. 

and also

I know you, dark prince, 
and I am not afraid of you. 
You aren’t at all how they describe you. 
You see through me, dark prince,
and are reflected in me. 
Let me stay near you.

summary: So I just watched this beautiful Aziraphale and Crowley vid on youtube (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a9nic5K4wJ0) by...
body: So I just watched this beautiful Aziraphale and Crowley vid on youtube (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a9nic5K4wJ0) by HostilePoet17 and now I’m listening to the background track “You & I” by Rhodes crying over what it would possibly be like to love someone for 6,000 years. I know I’m fantasizing the fuck out of actual romance, but I would like something like that.

reblog.comment: So I just watched this beautiful Aziraphale and Crowley vid on youtube (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a9nic5K4wJ0) by HostilePoet17 and now I’m listening to the background track “You & I” by Rhodes crying over what it would possibly be like to love someone for 6,000 years. I know I’m fantasizing the fuck out of actual romance, but I would like something like that.

I know I’m fantasizing the fuck out of actual romance, but I would like something like that.

I know I’m fantasizing the fuck out of actual romance, but I would like something like that.

summary: listen though in the bandstand scene when Crowley curses God, Aziraphale’s answer is a heartfelt-seeming “May you be forgiven.”...
body:
listen though in the bandstand scene when Crowley curses God, Aziraphale’s answer is a heartfelt-seeming “May you be forgiven.” and maybe that’s a knee-jerk reaction; he’s an angel, after all, and God is love, God is forgiveness. but then Crowley reacts to that.

“I won’t be forgiven. Not ever. That’s part of a demon’s job description. Unforgivable, that’s what I am.”

and at that moment, Aziraphale realizes something… Crowley truly believes that. and beyond that, so do the other angels, and so do the other demons. humans can repent and be forgiven, humans can redeem themselves, but what about demons? what about Crowley, specifically? Crowley, who is horrified by the idea of hurting children. Crowley, whose worst ‘deeds of the day’ tend to amount to pranks. Crowley, who has always been there, rescuing Zira at need, making him laugh, supporting him. Crowley, who has done good deeds, as part of the Arrangement, while Aziraphale himself has done evil. is Zira less unforgivable, then, just because he never fell, while still occasionally literally doing the work of Hell on earth? how can Crowley be unforgivable?

how long do you think Aziraphale thought about that after they parted from each other in anger (on a note which was very like a break up), not sure if or when he’d ever see Crowley again, or if he’d have a chance to say anything else to Crowley after that? how long do you think he regretted everything which had ever made Crowley feel that he’s unforgivable – unloveable, it’s not too far a stretch to say – and regretted that he himself never did enough to make Crowley feel otherwise?

it’s no surprise, then, that one of the very first things he says to Crowley the next time they speak is an instant and unreserved “I forgive you.” yes, on the surface it’s in the context of a response to Crowley saying “for someone so clever you can be very stupid” but I really don’t think that’s what Aziraphale is actually responding to.

because it’s not, this time, the platitude of “may you be forgiven,” that passive-voiced mealy little sentiment. may someone forgive you. someone, the divine, whoever. no. this time, it’s active, it’s direct, it’s first person. I forgive you.

he may never have said the “L word” but he didn’t need to. he did something which means just as much, between an angel and a demon. he gave his full and uncompromised forgiveness to a being which deserves it, and then some.

trail.content: Them

body:
Starters

I added these to the master list but here they are here too,, if you want to reply to one just message me! If you want to use one just credit me!


[Can be NSFW]

6. Aziraphale rode patiently in the passenger seat as Crowley ripped down the street with no caution. He wasn’t happy with the way Crowley drove but, it wasn’t his choice either. He didn’t learn to drive and if he wanted to get home from a long ways away then he’d have to deal with it. However they were on their way to Crowley’s flat this particular evening, he’d never been and he wasn’t sure he was ready to. He shifted in his seat, the Bentley’s low growl heavy in his ears as he tried to speak, “Crowley… you should really slow down. There’s no rush to get there.” He hummed simply, looking to the demon from the corner of his eye.

[NSFW]

7. Aziraphale was pushed roughly against the bookcase, his coat collar gripped in the demon’s hands tightly. He’d called Crowley nice, he’d done a nice thing on occasion but, Crowley didn’t like that word; he didn’t see himself that way. They’d been in this situation before but, that time it hadn’t felt like… this. This felt almost sexual in nature; something Aziraphale had not once thought of before. He wondered what Crowley would be feeling right now, maybe on some off chance, the same thing? “Crowley…” He stated the other’s name very quietly, searching the demon’s face. He knew the other was angry with him but, this was almost something he’d call an awkward situation.

blog.name: proficientatfreakness
blog.title: I am a ball of feels
blog.description:
To the world 
29 - she/her - bi - ADHD - @Kathee_HDS

tags: this was supposed to be short
body:
Good omens: Stardew Valley!AU

Aziraphale goes on missions of holy smiting in the mine while Crowley tends to the farm. Az befriends everyone in the village while AJCrow always gives them their most hated gifts and rummage in the trashcans because. Evil.

Aziraphale would love collecting all those ancient artifacts and lost books, and would convince Gunther to go on vacation to the desert just so he can roam freely through the museum.

Crowley would love the sauna, with its tropical garden upper floor, and would stay there for hours, just barely making it to Az’s farmhouse (since his cabin is too far away and all the good stuff is at Aziraphale’s, who has a cellar!!)

Also their greenhouse would have plenty of fruit trees and just the one apple tree right in the middle.

Since each farm can fit up to 4 people, we’d still have room for 2 more! All those great dynamics!!!

Like, one is Pollution and spends the day fishing and the other one is Brian and spends all the day foraging and cleaning the forest.

Or Gabriel and Beelzebub, they build a coop each, side by side, and fight to see who gets better produce from the animals under their care command.

Or Beel and Dagon who just stay in their cabin minding their own business

Or Hastur & Ligur who spend days lurking around Pelican Town {they have the “not fainting at 2am” mod active}

Or Sable who is trying to buy Gus out of business, while Pollution does their thing and floods the streets with trash

You could also have Anathema and Madame Tracy, because they’re the ones who know how to do shit around the farm, and they’d eventually befriend the wizard and witch. Anathema would totally manage several Slime farms and some rabbits and ducks, for their feathers and amulets.

And Shadwell and Newt would be ALL about completing the Community Center just to cach a glimpse of the Junimos and learn more about them/count their nipples and exorcise them if necessary.

Michael, Uriel and Sandalphon are too good to dirty their hands with all this nonsense. The three of them have their base in the Casino. They don’t play, but they’re always ready to strike if someone tries to cheat. Plus Michael is always in contact with Ligur, keeping tabs on everyone they lurk across. Just in case a bit of holy smiting is in order.

War and DEATH mostly live in the skeleton mines. War fights everything that approaches her, be it monsters or visitors. DEATH has their work cut out for them, for War is not one to lose a fight.

Pepper and Wensleydale would be forever fighting over whether to rebuild the Community Center or sell it to Joja Mart. I even see Wens becoming Morris’ boss after some time.

And Adam… Would just play around leisurely, Dog by his side, no stress. When he wants to pick some apples, he finds an apple tree just around the corner, never mind it wasn’t there before.

(Crowley would be very jealous because Aziraphale won’t let him miracle stuff, saying it’s cheating)

(Every other evening, Crowley and Az have dinner at Gus’ and the courses are dishes that aren’t in the menu at all. Aziraphale doesn’t mind cheating then, if it’s to share a meal with his demon)

Aziraphale would love collecting all those ancient artifacts and lost books, and would convince Gunther to go on vacation to the desert just so he can roam freely through the museum.

Crowley would love the sauna, with its tropical garden upper floor, and would stay there for hours, just barely making it to Az’s farmhouse (since his cabin is too far away and all the good stuff is at Aziraphale’s, who has a cellar!!)

Also their greenhouse would have plenty of fruit trees and just the one apple tree right in the middle.

Since each farm can fit up to 4 people, we’d still have room for 2 more! All those great dynamics!!!

Like, one is Pollution and spends the day fishing and the other one is Brian and spends all the day foraging and cleaning the forest.

Or Gabriel and Beelzebub, they build a coop each, side by side, and fight to see who gets better produce from the animals under their care command.

Or Beel and Dagon who just stay in their cabin minding their own business

Or Hastur & Ligur who spend days lurking around Pelican Town {they have the “not fainting at 2am” mod active}

Or Sable who is trying to buy Gus out of business, while Pollution does their thing and floods the streets with trash

You could also have Anathema and Madame Tracy, because they’re the ones who know how to do shit around the farm, and they’d eventually befriend the wizard and witch. Anathema would totally manage several Slime farms and some rabbits and ducks, for their feathers and amulets.

And Shadwell and Newt would be ALL about completing the Community Center just to cach a glimpse of the Junimos and learn more about them/count their nipples and exorcise them if necessary.

Michael, Uriel and Sandalphon are too good to dirty their hands with all this nonsense. The three of them have their base in the Casino. They don’t play, but they’re always ready to strike if someone tries to cheat. Plus Michael is always in contact with Ligur, keeping tabs on everyone they lurk across. Just in case a bit of holy smiting is in order.

War and DEATH mostly live in the skeleton mines. War fights everything that approaches her, be it monsters or visitors. DEATH has their work cut out for them, for War is not one to lose a fight.

Pepper and Wensleydale would be forever fighting over whether to rebuild the Community Center or sell it to Joja Mart. I even see Wens becoming Morris’ boss after some time.

And Adam… Would just play around leisurely, Dog by his side, no stress. When he wants to pick some apples, he finds an apple tree just around the corner, never mind it wasn’t there before.

(Crowley would be very jealous because Aziraphale won’t let him miracle stuff, saying it’s cheating)

(Every other evening, Crowley and Az have dinner at Gus’ and the courses are dishes that aren’t in the menu at all. Aziraphale doesn’t mind cheating then, if it’s to share a meal with his demon)
trail.content:
Good omens: Stardew Valley!AU

Aziraphale goes on missions of holy smiting in the mine while Crowley tends to the farm. Az befriends everyone in the village while AJCrow always gives them their most hated gifts and rummage in the trashcans because. Evil.

Aziraphale would love collecting all those ancient artifacts and lost books, and would convince Gunther to go on vacation to the desert just so he can roam freely through the museum.

Crowley would love the sauna, with its tropical garden upper floor, and would stay there for hours, just barely making it to Az’s farmhouse (since his cabin is too far away and all the good stuff is at Aziraphale’s, who has a cellar!!)

Also their greenhouse would have plenty of fruit trees and just the one apple tree right in the middle.

Since each farm can fit up to 4 people, we’d still have room for 2 more! All those great dynamics!!!

Like, one is Pollution and spends the day fishing and the other one is Brian and spends all the day foraging and cleaning the forest.

Or Gabriel and Beelzebub, they build a coop each, side by side, and fight to see who gets better produce from the animals under their care command.

Or Beel and Dagon who just stay in their cabin minding their own business

Or Hastur & Ligur who spend days lurking around Pelican Town {they have the “not fainting at 2am” mod active}

Or Sable who is trying to buy Gus out of business, while Pollution does their thing and floods the streets with trash

You could also have Anathema and Madame Tracy, because they’re the ones who know how to do shit around the farm, and they’d eventually befriend the wizard and witch. Anathema would totally manage several Slime farms and some rabbits and ducks, for their feathers and amulets.

And Shadwell and Newt would be ALL about completing the Community Center just to cach a glimpse of the Junimos and learn more about them/count their nipples and exorcise them if necessary.

Michael, Uriel and Sandalphon are too good to dirty their hands with all this nonsense. The three of them have their base in the Casino. They don’t play, but they’re always ready to strike if someone tries to cheat. Plus Michael is always in contact with Ligur, keeping tabs on everyone they lurk across. Just in case a bit of holy smiting is in order.

War and DEATH mostly live in the skeleton mines. War fights everything that approaches her, be it monsters or visitors. DEATH has their work cut out for them, for War is not one to lose a fight.

Pepper and Wensleydale would be forever fighting over whether to rebuild the Community Center or sell it to Joja Mart. I even see Wens becoming Morris’ boss after some time.

And Adam… Would just play around leisurely, Dog by his side, no stress. When he wants to pick some apples, he finds an apple tree just around the corner, never mind it wasn’t there before.

(Crowley would be very jealous because Aziraphale won’t let him miracle stuff, saying it’s cheating)

(Every other evening, Crowley and Az have dinner at Gus’ and the courses are dishes that aren’t in the menu at all. Aziraphale doesn’t mind cheating then, if it’s to share a meal with his demon)

tags: like this is a serious question
summary:
Do I regret spending every day obsessing over two people who are made for each other?
No.
But do I regret all the angst and...
body:
Do I regret spending every day obsessing over two people who are made for each other?
No.
But do I regret all the angst and frustration I put myself through in doing so?
Still a no.

blog.description: I have many fandoms for which I write fanfiction, making fanart, select fanmixes and edit fanvids for, all for no profit because I'm just a fan. I set up this tumblr to rant about my real life issues... but I fear it will just be about fandom.

title: Yet Another Ineffable Husbands Thought
body:
I’m still super hung up on the statue in Crowley’s apartment, but I was wondering if part of the reason Crowley’s wings were black in the TV adaption was because of that statue, where the fallen angel had darker wings. 

I still can’t get over how suggestive that statue is. But I can’t see Crowley wanting a statue where good and evil are wrestling, and evil is winning. Crowley doesn’t really believe in sides. He just believes in Aziraphale. 

I need someone to tell me the backstory of that statue. It’s been two weeks and this show will not let me rest!

tags: idk what this is or if it makes sense
but i've been thinking about it a lot
this is a trash sideblog so i do what i want
eta: i did NOT expect this to get notes
summary: I keep thinking about the number of times Michael Sheen stated something along the lines of Aziraphale, as an angel, existing as...
body:
I keep thinking about the number of times Michael Sheen stated something along the lines of Aziraphale, as an angel, existing as a being of love, and approaching him that way in his performance. we get to witness it constantly. loving his bookshop, good food, having a soft spot for humanity and the world, and of course, profoundly, loving Crowley (in whatever way one wishes to define that love), even though he technically shouldn’t, since they’re meant to be opposed to one another. and it’s such a wonderful approach because the other angels actually are NOT beings of love in any way, at all. they can’t fathom it. there are a lot of posts discussing the dichotomy of Aziraphale/Crowley and the meaning of Crowley being so capable of unexpected goodness, and Aziraphale being “just enough of a bastard” in both words and actions at times, and all of those are excellent points and fascinating (and vital) layers to their characters, but the capacity for love and kindness is what makes them both extraordinary. Aziraphale is totally different from the other angels from the very beginning (giving away his sword because he’s worried about Adam and Eve’s safety), and Crowley is totally different from the other demons from the very beginning (that initial temptation being one of knowledge, not evil, and he’s immediately concerned with and interested in the meanings of that morality, something the other demons don’t ever display the capacity to ponder).

it’s not love that makes Aziraphale an angel, it’s actually love that sets him apart from the rest. that’s a much more obvious difference in Crowley (though no less important). for both of them, even if their respective expressions/understandings of all that love is, well, ineffable, it’s absolutely fundamental.

their bond to the world and to one another is intrinsic because of such an array of qualities between them, and every aspect of that is sublime, but what’s most remarkable to me is how their most unique and beautiful qualities revolve around things we think of as essential to existence. imagination. companionship. understanding. the ability to reason about good/evil with nuance rather than fundamentalism. enjoyment of simple pleasures. the profoundness of love.

summary:
romance these days is dead. 
don’t even speak to me unless you’re willing to break me out of prison where i await my execution...
body:
romance these days is dead.

don’t even speak to me unless you’re willing to break me out of prison where i await my execution for dressing up like french bourgeoisie.

don’t even look at me unless you’re ready to bring me what is essentially an extremely potent and deadly poison because you finally learned to trust me enough not to take it and be responsible around it.

don’t even breath in my direction unless you drop a bomb on a church full of nazis while being considerate enough to preserve my extremely rare and improant books in the process.

tags: i feel like I've finally reached complete out of character-land
honestly i would die for chubey az
summary: Could you right a thing about Az being all soft and lovely??? Maybe one day he gets kinda self conscious and Crowley is just...
question: Could you right a thing about Az being all soft and lovely??? Maybe one day he gets kinda self conscious and Crowley is just having none of it and will literally fight Gabriel for fat shaming his husband
answer:
“You like me, right?” Aziraphale asked, while he sceptically eyed a plate of dinner he would usually have devoured by now. Not that Crowley would ever call it ‘devouring’ to the angel’s face. Right now, however, he looked demotivated at best and downright depressed at worst, and then there was this question.

“Would I have chased after you for the last six thousand years if I didn’t like you?” he asked back. Aziraphale didn’t meet his eyes and Crowley hated that.

“I suppose not,” he replied quietly and chewed – chewed – on a spoonful of mashed potatoes. “But do you actually like me?”

Crowley swallowed down the impulse to ask him if he knew how absolutely daft he was being, and instead, gently took the cutlery from between Aziraphale’s fingers and grasped his hands.

“What does that mean?” he asked, internally triumphant at how calm it sounded.

“Are you attracted to me?”

“What have I ever done, that led you to believe otherwise?” He looked into Aziraphale’s eyes and encountered an insecurity he had seen before, but he still didn’t know where it stemmed from.

“Nothing,” Aziraphale admitted.

“What is it, then?”

“I meant physically. Are you physically attracted to me?” Aziraphale asked and looked at the wall somewhere behind Crowley.

“Yes, I am,” Crowley said and didn’t dare ask further questions. He just sat still and held Aziraphale’s hands between his own, while he waited for Aziraphale to direct the conversation further.

“You’re not – you like me, even though I’m a bit pudgy?”

“Why ever wouldn’t I?” Crowley asked. He couldn’t believe Aziraphale was doubting himself over something like this.

“I don’t know,” Aziraphale said, looking small and fragile suddenly. Crowley leaned forward, across the corner of the table and pressed a gentle kiss against the corner of Aziraphale’s lips.

“Listen, angel. I’d feel the same for you, in any shape you could possibly have. But the one you do have is just perfect and I wouldn’t change it for the world.”

There were tears in the angel’s eyes, which Crowley decided to ignore, squeezing Aziraphale’s hands, before letting go. When his forearms were safely out of sight under the table, he clenched his hands into painfully cramped fists.

“I mean it, love,” he said and the admiration in Aziraphale’s tear-glistening eyes at the pet name, reassured Crowley a little.

“What brought this about?” Crowley asked nonetheless.

“Nothing.” 

Crowley glared at him. 

“Something Gabriel said. But it’s not his fault, he’s right.”

“I should have killed him when I had the chance,” Crowley hissed, then forced himself to relax as he turned to Aziraphale.

“You have to stop listening to him, he’s not even your superior anymore. Wait – was he ever really your boss? Didn’t you answer directly to -?” He jerked his head vaguely upwards.

Aziraphale only shrugged.

“Hey,” Crowley said and reached out his right hand for the angel’s chin, lifting it up so their eyes met. “Hey, you’re perfect. And I don’t care how often I have to tell you but if you need me to, I will.”

This time, Aziraphale leaned in for a chaste kiss, that was over before Crowley’s muddled brain even caught up with it.

“Thanks,” Aziraphale said and put another spoonful of mashed potatoes into his mouth. Again, he chewed.

Crowley supposed, that was just a thing he did, after all.

Crowley glared at him. 

“Something Gabriel said. But it’s not his fault, he’s right.”

“I should have killed him when I had the chance,” Crowley hissed, then forced himself to relax as he turned to Aziraphale.

“You have to stop listening to him, he’s not even your superior anymore. Wait – was he ever really your boss? Didn’t you answer directly to -?” He jerked his head vaguely upwards.

Aziraphale only shrugged.

“Hey,” Crowley said and reached out his right hand for the angel’s chin, lifting it up so their eyes met. “Hey, you’re perfect. And I don’t care how often I have to tell you but if you need me to, I will.”

This time, Aziraphale leaned in for a chaste kiss, that was over before Crowley’s muddled brain even caught up with it.

“Thanks,” Aziraphale said and put another spoonful of mashed potatoes into his mouth. Again, he chewed.

Crowley supposed, that was just a thing he did, after all.
trail.content:
“You like me, right?” Aziraphale asked, while he sceptically eyed a plate of dinner he would usually have devoured by now. Not that Crowley would ever call it ‘devouring’ to the angel’s face. Right now, however, he looked demotivated at best and downright depressed at worst, and then there was this question.

“Would I have chased after you for the last six thousand years if I didn’t like you?” he asked back. Aziraphale didn’t meet his eyes and Crowley hated that.

“I suppose not,” he replied quietly and chewed – chewed – on a spoonful of mashed potatoes. “But do you actually like me?”

Crowley swallowed down the impulse to ask him if he knew how absolutely daft he was being, and instead, gently took the cutlery from between Aziraphale’s fingers and grasped his hands.

“What does that mean?” he asked, internally triumphant at how calm it sounded.

“Are you attracted to me?”

“What have I ever done, that led you to believe otherwise?” He looked into Aziraphale’s eyes and encountered an insecurity he had seen before, but he still didn’t know where it stemmed from.

“Nothing,” Aziraphale admitted.

“What is it, then?”

“I meant physically. Are you physically attracted to me?” Aziraphale asked and looked at the wall somewhere behind Crowley.

“Yes, I am,” Crowley said and didn’t dare ask further questions. He just sat still and held Aziraphale’s hands between his own, while he waited for Aziraphale to direct the conversation further.

“You’re not – you like me, even though I’m a bit pudgy?”

“Why ever wouldn’t I?” Crowley asked. He couldn’t believe Aziraphale was doubting himself over something like this.

“I don’t know,” Aziraphale said, looking small and fragile suddenly. Crowley leaned forward, across the corner of the table and pressed a gentle kiss against the corner of Aziraphale’s lips.

“Listen, angel. I’d feel the same for you, in any shape you could possibly have. But the one you do have is just perfect and I wouldn’t change it for the world.”

There were tears in the angel’s eyes, which Crowley decided to ignore, squeezing Aziraphale’s hands, before letting go. When his forearms were safely out of sight under the table, he clenched his hands into painfully cramped fists.

“I mean it, love,” he said and the admiration in Aziraphale’s tear-glistening eyes at the pet name, reassured Crowley a little.

“What brought this about?” Crowley asked nonetheless.

“Nothing.” 

Crowley glared at him. 

“Something Gabriel said. But it’s not his fault, he’s right.”

“I should have killed him when I had the chance,” Crowley hissed, then forced himself to relax as he turned to Aziraphale.

“You have to stop listening to him, he’s not even your superior anymore. Wait – was he ever really your boss? Didn’t you answer directly to -?” He jerked his head vaguely upwards.

Aziraphale only shrugged.

“Hey,” Crowley said and reached out his right hand for the angel’s chin, lifting it up so their eyes met. “Hey, you’re perfect. And I don’t care how often I have to tell you but if you need me to, I will.”

This time, Aziraphale leaned in for a chaste kiss, that was over before Crowley’s muddled brain even caught up with it.

“Thanks,” Aziraphale said and put another spoonful of mashed potatoes into his mouth. Again, he chewed.

Crowley supposed, that was just a thing he did, after all.

summary: Okay, so I started making my first Ineffable Husbands fanart and I was smiling the whole time (probably because I watched Good...
body:
Okay, so I started making my first Ineffable Husbands fanart and I was smiling the whole time (probably because I watched Good Omens for the third time while drawing) - it’s not finished yet but have some spoilers anyway😅

It started with this quick doodle (!!) that I made this morning (after like 5 hours of sleep so beware) because these two were showing up in my dream 💕- nothing worth mentioning, just rubbish:

And turned (so far) into this (no, I’m not going to show you everything, I still need to color it and erase all the lines where Crowley and Aziraphale are standing in front of the other one 😅):

Aww, making that Good Omens logo gayer was such fun and I’m in love w/ it. Also, it’s Pride Month🌈 and a little rainbow hasn’t hurt anyone yet (and it’s reminder that God will not drown us again 😉)
